agency_desc: A community action agency that designs, sponsors, and administers programs that provide help for today and hope for tomorrow.
site_name: INTERLOCAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - RUSH COUNTY
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Rush County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). Persons already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Applications for the waiting list is closed. When they are open, you will be required to create a Waitlist Check account and have a valid email address.

site_schedule.name: Section 8 Housing Choice Vouchers
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-5pm; Fri 8am-4pm -- Waiting List: CLOSED

site_eligibility: Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families
Household income at or below 200% of Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: An electricity cooperative that serves customers in Bartholomew, Decatur, Fayette, Franklin, Hancock, Henry, Johnson, Rush, and Shelby. Metered propane gas, telephone, Internet, and other utility services are also available.
service_description: Provides metered propane and electric service to Rush and Shelby County as well as parts of Bartholomew, Decatur, Fayette, Franklin, Hancock, Henry, and Johnson County.
site_details: For new service, call or visit website for application for new service; signed application may be returned by fax or mail. -- Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this   address.
site_eligibility: Living within service area

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: A food pantry serving persons in need in Rush County.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food as well as toiletries to Rush County persons in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
site_details: Pantry is currently operating as a drive-thru handing out pre-packaged bags.
site_eligibility: Living in Rush County; Not used this pantry more than twice within past 28 days

agency_name: SAINT MARY OF THE IMMACULATE CONCEPTION CATHOLIC CHURCH
agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry and financial assistance.
site_name: SAINT MARY OF THE IMMACULATE CONCEPTION CATHOLIC CHURCH
service_description: Provides direct assistance to people in need of paying on a utility such gas, electric, and water bill or rental assistance. Also, may help pay selective prescription expenses. Assistance is given on case to case basis. Funds are not always available.  Limited service area.
site_details: Call for an intake assessment. A meeting will be scheduled to submit required documents in completing the application.
site_eligibility: Limit one visit per year
Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, and field trips. Provides public transportation for those living in Rush County.
service_description: Provides transportation in and out of town within 50-mile radius on an as-needed schedule. Medical transportation is also provided to Medicaid recipients. Wheelchair accessible vehicles are available. Passengers must be capable of self care or be accompanied by a care provider.
site_details: Call in advance to schedule ride: 24 hours notice for general transportation -- Medicaid transportation: Out of county travel requires one week notice, In-county travel requires 24 hours notice
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Offers weekly home delivery of library materials to residents of the city of Rushville in Rush County.
site_details: Call to request delivery.
site_eligibility: Living in the city of Rushville in Rush County -- Home bound due to chronic or extended illness or physical disability
Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a resident library card: Living in Rushville

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides water, sanitary sewer, and storm-water utility services to the city of Rushville in Rush County.
site_details: Call for assistance. Bills may be paid online, in person, or by mail; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Rushville

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, residential recycling, trash pick-up, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Rushville in Rush County.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted

site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Rushville
Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Rush County.
service_description: Provides recorded information on travel conditions, or advisories in place due to weather conditions or other hazardous situations in Rush County.
site_details: Call for information.

site_schedule.name: County Offices of Emergency Services
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on call for emergencies: Daily 24 Hours

site_schedule.name: Disaster Relief/Recovery Organizations
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on call for emergencies: Daily 24 Hours

site_schedule.name: Emergency Preparedness and Response Planning
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on call for emergencies: Daily 24 Hours

site_schedule.name: Sandbags/Water Diversion Systems
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on call for emergencies: Daily 24 Hours

site_schedule.name: General Disaster Information
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on call for emergencies: Daily 24 Hours

site_eligibility: Open; information for Rush County
Persons who live or work in Rush County
Open
Mobile home occupants -- Low income

agency_desc: Provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Ripley Township of Rush County, or a Knightstown library cardholder.

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that provides limited financial assistance to those living in Rush County.
service_description: Provides up to $100 for individuals and families needing help with rent, utilities, and medical expenses. Clients are limited to one visit every six months. Assistance is not guaranteed. Limited service area.
site_details: Call or email to schedule an intake appointment. -- Leave a voicemail with name, phone number, and type of assistance needed for return call the next business day.
site_eligibility: Open -- Not received assistance from this agency in the past 6 months

agency_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF RUSHVILLE
agency_desc: A nonprofit club for youth.
site_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF RUSH COUNTY
service_description: Provides a positive, supervised environment for young people after school and over the summer. Programs emphasize character and leadership, education and career development, the arts, life skills, health and fitness, sports, and recreation.
site_details: Email, call, or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Boys and girls age 5-19 years-old

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from an Rush Memorial Hospital. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income. Applications are also available from financial counselors located at Rush Memorial Hospital.
site_details: Patients MUST submit an application for financial assistance in order to be considered for assistance. -- Call and request to speak with the Patient Financial Services office to apply.
site_eligibility: Received or receiving medically necessary health care services from Rush Memorial Hospital (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- Low to moderate income (Those below 200% of Federal Poverty Level   may be eligible for free care.)
Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Rushville in Rush County. For emergency police services, persons in Rushville should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call city dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Rushville in Rush county

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Rushville in Rush County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations for the city of Rushville in Rush County. Nonemergency services include fire prevention education and public awareness. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during normal business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in the city of Rushville in Rush County.
Living in the city of Rushville in Rush County -- Homeowners -- Financial need

agency_desc: Provides assistance and support for domestic violence victims, and operates a crisis shelter.
service_description: Provides a CRISIS shelter for individuals (with or without children) fleeing domestic violence. Support services include case management, and legal advocacy.  No face to face at this time due to Covid virus.  All correspondence is conducted on phone, internet or texting until further notice.  Please use these methods to contact RCVA.
site_details: Call for intake interview.
site_eligibility: Living in Rush County -- Females and males with or without children -- Fleeing domestic abuse in a CRISIS situation. No face to face at this time due to Covid virus.  All correspondence will be conducted on phone, internet or texting until further notice.  Please use these methods to contact RCVA.
Call for more information.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 6 months or older
Varies by service; serves Rush County
Living within the county
Varies by service
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County

Living within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Age 19 or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers free health screenings, including blood pressure and blood sugar, to all.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Rush County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, and enforces traffic laws.
site_details: Call or walk in for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Rush County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Rush County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices

site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county
Varies by service; Open

agency_desc: Provides shelter for stray and unwanted animals and rehomes animals through adoption. Offers lost-and-found services, microchipping of pets, owner-requested euthanasia services for terminally ill pets, and accepts surrendered animals from the public.
service_description: Accepts donations of pet supplies for shelter use. Needed items often include pet food, blankets, and towels. Volunteers to assist with shelter duties, including kennel maintenance and animal socialization, are also welcome.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.

site_schedule.name: Animal Control
site_schedule.schedule: Shelter: Mon noon-5pm; Tues-Fri 10am-5pm -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Animal Adoption
site_schedule.schedule: Shelter: Mon noon-5pm; Tues-Fri 10am-5pm -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Animal Lost and Found
site_schedule.schedule: Shelter: Mon noon-5pm; Tues-Fri 10am-5pm -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Animal Shelters
site_schedule.schedule: Shelter: Mon noon-5pm; Tues-Fri 10am-5pm -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Pet Tracking Microchips
site_schedule.schedule: Shelter: Mon noon-5pm; Tues-Fri 10am-5pm -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: To Donate: Open -- To Volunteer: Age 16 or older; those under age 16 require the presence of a parent/guardian
To Report an Animal Concern: Open (serves Rush County) -- To Surrender a Pet: Living in Rush County

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Rush County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Rush County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Rush County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Rush County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Rush County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Rush County
Rush County juveniles age 17 or under
Offenders assigned to probation by the Rush Courts
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours. Psychiatric rehabilitation may be offered to eligible clients.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Access Line for intake assessment or to make an appointment. -- For crisis intervention, walk in during normal business hours or call the Crisis Line at any time.

site_schedule.name: Outpatient Mental Health Facilities
site_schedule.schedule: Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

site_schedule.name: General Counseling Services

agency_name: HOOSIER YOUTH CHALLENGE ACADEMY - INDIANA NATIONAL GUARD
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides behavioral intervention and a residential training academy for youth ages 16-18 years old.
site_name: HOOSIER YOUTH CHALLENGE ACADEMY - INDIANA NATIONAL GUARD
service_description: Offers a behavioral intervention and residential military-based training for youth who have dropped out of or been expelled from high school, or are deficient in credits. Residents must pass a drug screening after the first month in the program. Training includes life skills, job skills, leadership, basic education, and military-style physical activity. After 5 months of residential training, participants work with mentors for one year to achieve their life, employment, and academic goals. There is no military obligation for participants.
site_details: Call or complete the online form to request an application or to be connected with a regional recruiter.
site_eligibility: Age 16-18 years-old -- Dropped out or expelled from high school, or deficient in credits -- Unemployed or under-employed -- No felony convictions -- Mentally and physically able to complete the program -- Citizen or legal resident of the United States and Indiana

agency_desc: A nonprofit healthcare organization that provides a range of physical and mental health services.
service_description: Offers affordable primary health care for uninsured and underinsured people. Services include family practice, pediatrics, sexually transmitted disease screenings, women's health services, laboratory testing, immunizations, diabetes treatment, asthma treatment, and patient education.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open
Age 18 and older
